page.title: 07Strange Things at Durlston
page.content: Within our study area there are strange bollards and signs. These are London street bollards of cast iron, which are now used as fence posts, gate posts or just marking some long forgotten boundary, they are even part of an old kissing gate at Durlston Farm. John Mowlem, a London mason,a Swanage man originally, with his nephew George Burt; brought them to Swanage when alterations and demolitions in London were destroying them. These bollards have the names of many London districts on them. Throughout the Durlston area there are also many inscriptions on stone tablets provided by the Victorian benefactor George Burt. .
